title: Olivia Colman reveals husband stole toilet roll from Buckingham Palace
text:
Olivia Colman’s husband stole loo roll from Buckingham Palace (Picture: Getty)

Olivia Colman’s revelation about her husband stealing a roll of toilet paper from Buckingham Palace is unlikely to impress the queen but it’s sure cracked us up (there are more puns where that came from).

In fact, Queen Liz was probably trying to get to the (wait for it) bottom of it all until now.

Speaking to The Sunday Times, the Oscar-winning actress flat out admitted: ‘My husband stole some loo roll just to say we got it from Buckingham Palace.’

Olivia and husband Ed Sinclair were visiting the residence of the English reigning monarch for a charity event where they met Prince William.

But this latest revelation might mean the couple’s hopes of another invitation could go down the drain (sorry, that’s the last pun).

Olivia Colman and Ed Sinclair may not be invited back to Buckingham Palace after stealing a roll of toilet paper (Picture: Harrison/Getty Images)

During the interview, the 45-year-old actress also revealed she has become a ‘leftie monarchist’ while portraying Queen Elizabeth in the upcoming season of The Crown. She replaced Claire Foy, who portrayed Queen Elizabeth in the first two seasons of the hit-show.

Olivia revealed: ‘I’ve become a leftie monarchist, and there’s not many of them about.’

Always a staunch republican, Olivia now views the queen as ‘an extraordinary human being.’

She added: ‘However you feel about her, she’s been our constant. We are all so relaxed about her being there that one day, when she’s not, it’s going to be a shock.’

Olivia stressed the importance of fans of the show recognising it’s a dramatisation of Queen Elizabeth’s life and may be based on real life events, but dialogue and inner workings of the family are largely fictional.

Olivia Colman as Queen Elizabeth in The Crown, season three (Picture: Netflix)

‘We know she loves to escape to the Highlands,’ Olivia shared. ‘She probably goes crazy up there.

‘She must release in some way, running around naked, screaming and pulling her hair out,’ she joked.

Olivia then warned: ‘If people think they’re going to see the actual Queen, they can sod off. It’s a drama.’

The Crown season three will begin streaming on 17 November on Netflix.
